thread.title: UCLA receiver/safety Mossi Johnson out for the season with knee injury - The
thread.title_full: UCLA receiver/safety Mossi Johnson out for the season with knee injury - The Orange County Register

title: UCLA receiver/safety Mossi Johnson out for the season with knee injury - The
text:
UCLA sophomore Mossi Johnson sustained a severe knee injury in a 1-on-1 drill at practice last week and will miss the rest of the season, according to Coach Jim Mora .
Mora said after practice Sunday morning that Johnson injured his ACL, MCL and PCL, "about everything," but did not specifiy what knee was injured.
He will have surgery in the next couple weeks. 
Johnson, a receiver, moved to safety during the week of practice before the Bruins' Pac-12 opener at Arizona on Sept. 26, a move coinciding with the loss of cornerback Fabian Moreau , who is out for the season with a broken foot.
In Moreau's absence, safety Randall Goforth moved to cornerback, creating a need at safety.
UCLA has lost three defensive starters to season-ending injuries, also including star linebacker Myles Jack , who has since left the school, and defensive lineman Eddie Vanderdoes .
"They've worked so hard to get where they are, and in all four of those guys' cases, they're lost for the season," Mora said. "They had great offseasons. They're on track for really good years. You hate to see that."
Johnson was practicing at both receiver and safety. 
Listed at 6 feet and 185 pounds, he caught eight passes for 41 yards in the first three games before the switch.
Last season, he caught 23 passes for 232 yards and one touchdown, a 15-yarder from Brett Hundley in a November win at Washington.
